content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Implement AS MANY new ideas as you can as PopeBot skills in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). For EACH skill: create the SKILL.md, write the implementation code, and write and run a test to prove it works. Do not stop at one skill â€” keep going until you run out of good ideas or time. After you have built and tested everything, use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a comprehensive progress report listing every skill you built, your test results for each, and code samples.

content.thinking:
This is a comprehensive task. Let me break it down:

1. First, I need to scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures:
   - https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw
   - https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw
   - https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot

2. For each interesting idea I find, I need to:
   - Create a SKILL.md file in .pi/skills/
   - Write the implementation code
   - Write and run a test to prove it works

3. Finally, send an email to winsorllc@yahoo.com with a comprehensive progress report

Let me start by exploring these repositories. I'll use the browser-tools skill to inspect the repositories, or I could try to clone them. Let me first check what's already in the current .pi/skills directory and what tools are available.

Let me start by:
1. Checking the current .pi/skills directory
2. Using git to clone or inspect the repositories
3. Looking for interesting patterns, tools, and architectures

Let me begin!

arguments.command: ls -la pi-skills/ 2>/dev/null || echo "pi-skills directory not found"

Let me check the environment and explore the repositories to discover new tools and architectures:

content.thinking: Good, I have access to SERPAPI_KEY and GITHUB_TOKEN. Let me now clone the three repositories to examine their codebases for new tools, skills, and architectures.

arguments.command: mkdir -p /job/tmp/repos && cd /job/tmp/repos && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw.git zeroclaw 2>&1 | tail -5
cd /job/tmp/repos && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw.git openclaw 2>&1 | tail -5
